pullRequest.body:
We define a typeclass `HasSheafify` which says that presheaves on a site with values in some category can be sheafified, i.e. that the inclusion functor from sheaves to presheaves has a left exact left adjoint. We redefine `presheafToSheaf` as an arbitrary choice of such a left adjoint.

---

nodes.body: Can you split the file rename into a separate PR so that the diff looks better?
#9042 is just the file name change
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7467358813/job/20320707618)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7467358813/job/20320707457)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7467358813/job/20320707095)

LGTM! The only "gotcha" I see resulting from this is that one would have to import `Sites.LeftExact` in order to obtain the `HasSheafify` instance for concrete categories with the required properties, which might be counter-intuitive. Perhaps we should document this somewhere, e.g. in the module docstring of `Sites.Sheafification`?

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion (sheafificationAdjunction J D).unit.app P = J.toSheafify P := rfl ```

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.Sheafification import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Sites.Sieves ```

Sorry that it took me a long time before reviewing this PR.

I would much prefer if this can still be called `sheafify`. Can't that be accomplished using namespaces?
As in: does the new `sheafify` really need to be in the `GrothendieckTopology` namespace?

Sorry for taking so long to respond! 

I'll change `GrothendieckTopology.plusPlus` back to `GrothendieckTopology.sheafify` and move the new `sheafify` outside the `GrothendieckTopology` namespace. Is there a smart way to do this in VS Code or do I have to go through everything manually?

I made the change, now there are probably some places where the old `GrothendieckTopology.sheafify` API is used  where it could be replaced by the new `sheafify` API, but if either one works we can just leave it and change later if desired.
This docstring has a typo and is not quite precise. The existence of a left adjoint is called `HasWeakSheafify` and the existence of sheafification is called `HasSheafify`.
This shouldn't be part of this PR, but in the future we should think about making `IsRightAdjoint` into a prop!
Similarly, in the future we should make `PreservesLimits` and friends into a prop.
Please add a comment in the docstring mentioning `.mk'`. It seems to me like this is the most common way to construct an instance of this class!
I don't know whether `align` statements are required for refactors such as this.
It comes from the definition that was previously named `presheafToSheaf` and is now `plusPlusSheaf`. Should I move this align statement below `plusPlusSheaf` or just remove it altogether?
TBH, I don't know. Can you ask on zulip?
Is the `dsimp` really necessary? (similarly below)
Is this `simp` necessary, given that `toSheafification` is an `abbrev`?
Can you please move these closer to where `sheafificationAdjunction` is defined?
Moved them as high as I could but they use stuff defined later than `sheafificationAdjunction`
